notes.text:
Updated images are now available for Red Hat Advanced Cluster Security for Kubernetes (RHACS). The updated image includes security and bug fixes.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact
of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score,
which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability
from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
This release of RHACS 4.5.3 includes the security fix for the following CVE:

* (CVE-2024-39249) Inefficient Regular Expression Complexity

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.

This release of RHACS includes the following updates:

* Fixed a broken pipe error that caused the Central UI dashboard to display incomplete data.
* Added a new `--with-database-only` option to the `roxctl central debug download-diagnostics` command. Use it to generate diagnostic bundles for troubleshooting connection issues related to policy violations and deployments.
notes.title: Details

notes.text: A flaw was found in the async Node.js package. A Regular expression Denial of Service (ReDoS) attack can potentially be triggered via the autoinject function while parsing specially crafted input.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: nodejs-async: Regular expression denial of service while parsing function in autoinject
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details: If you are using an earlier version of RHACS 4.5, you are advised to upgrade to this patch release 4.5.3.

vulnerabilities.title: nodejs-async: Regular expression denial of service while parsing function in autoinject
